headers.name: Access-Token
headers.description: Authorized access token. For details, see Authentication .

headers.name: Content-Type
headers.description: Request message type. Allowed format: application/json .

parameters.name: object_type
parameters.description: Object type. Object type. Use this field to specify whether you want to create negative keywords for a campaign or ad group. Enum values: CAMPAIGN : campaign. ADGROUP : ad group.

parameters.name: object_ids
parameters.description: Object IDs. Use this field to pass in campaign IDs or ad group IDs that you want to create negative keywords for. Max size: 50. Specify this field according to object_type : If object_type is CAMPAIGN , assign campaign IDs to this field. If object_type is ADGROUP , assign ad group IDs to this field.

parameters.name: replace
parameters.description: Whether to replace all the existing negative keywords for the campaign or ad group with the keywords that you specify via keywords . Enum values: true : To replace all the existing negative keywords. false : To add new negative keywords. Default value: false .

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: The list of negative keywords you want to create. Max size: 1,000. Note : For each ad group, you can configure a maximum of 10,000 negative keywords.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the negative keyword you want to create. Length limit: 80 characters. The name needs to exclude the following special characters: [ ! , @ , % , ^ , ( , ) , = , { , } , ; , ~ , ` , < , > , ? , \ , | ]. Otherwise, an error will occur. Note : Duplicate negative keyword names will be de-duplicated to only one unique name, and for each unique name you can only specify one match type.

parameters.name: match_type
parameters.description: Match type for the negative keyword. Enum values: PRECISE_WORD : exact match. PHRASE_WORD : phrase match. BROAD_WORD : broad match. Default value: BROAD_WORD .
